headline: Amazon bungles Wednesday layoff plan with misfired internal email
summary: Amazon on Tuesday appeared to have prematurely alerted Amazon Web Services cloud-computing employees to layoffs planned ​for Wednesday morning by sending a commiseration email and team-wide meeting ‌invitation hours early.  Reuters reported on Friday that Amazon intended to lay off thousands of corporate employees starting ‌this week.  The email sent on Tuesday signed by Colleen Aubrey, senior vice president of applied AI solutions at AWS, wrongly said that impacted employees in ⁠the U.S., Canada and Costa ‌Rica had already been informed they lost their jobs.

content.title: Amazon bungles Wednesday layoff plan with misfired internal email
content.summary: Amazon on Tuesday appeared to have prematurely alerted Amazon Web Services cloud-computing employees to layoffs planned ​for Wednesday morning by sending a commiseration email and team-wide meeting ‌invitation hours early.  Reuters reported on Friday that Amazon intended to lay off thousands of corporate employees starting ‌this week.  The email sent on Tuesday signed by Colleen Aubrey, senior vice president of applied AI solutions at AWS, wrongly said that impacted employees in ⁠the U.S., Canada and Costa ‌Rica had already been informed they lost their jobs.

thumbnail.caption: FILE PHOTO: Amazon.com Inc said on Tuesday it plans to cut its global corporate workforce by as many as 14,000 roles and sieze the opportunity provided by artificial intelligence (AI)

headline: SUNHOUSE AND ANCHANTO FORGE STRATEGIC GLOBAL PARTNERSHIP: DIGITALIZING SUPPLY CHAIN TO DRIVE 300% E-COMMERCE GROWTH
summary: Sunhouse Group, a prestigious National home appliance brand in Vietnam, today officially announced a strategic partnership with Anchanto, a global leader in Omnichannel Commerce and Logistics SaaS technology. This project marks a monumental step in Sunhouse's digital transformation journey, involving the deployment of a comprehensive Order Management System (OMS) across four countries and Warehouse Management System (WMS) at two key regional logistics hubs.

content.title: SUNHOUSE AND ANCHANTO FORGE STRATEGIC GLOBAL PARTNERSHIP: DIGITALIZING SUPPLY CHAIN TO DRIVE 300% E-COMMERCE GROWTH
content.summary: Sunhouse Group, a prestigious National home appliance brand in Vietnam, today officially announced a strategic partnership with Anchanto, a global leader in Omnichannel Commerce and Logistics SaaS technology. This project marks a monumental step in Sunhouse's digital transformation journey, involving the deployment of a comprehensive Order Management System (OMS) across four countries and Warehouse Management System (WMS) at two key regional logistics hubs.

thumbnail.caption: Sunhouse Group and Anchanto formalize their global partnership at the official signing ceremony in Hanoi

headline: Amazon Reshapes Grocery Footprint And Workforce As Valuation Draws Attention
summary: Amazon.com (NasdaqGS:AMZN) is closing all Amazon Go and Amazon Fresh physical stores and converting many locations to Whole Foods Market stores. The company plans to invest in more than 100 new Whole Foods Market locations as part of a broader reshaping of its grocery footprint. Amazon is also announcing corporate layoffs affecting up to 30,000 jobs globally, including roles in AWS and Prime Video. The changes reflect a major shift in how Amazon approaches physical retail, operations, and...

headline: UPS Q4 Deep Dive: Automation, Network Reconfiguration, and Amazon Glide Down Shape Outlook
summary: Parcel delivery company UPS (NYSE:UPS) reported Q4 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, but sales fell by 3.2% year on year to $24.48 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $89.7 billion at the midpoint came in 2% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.38 per share was 8.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: UPS Q4 Deep Dive: Automation, Network Reconfiguration, and Amazon Glide Down Shape Outlook
content.summary: Parcel delivery company UPS (NYSE:UPS) reported Q4 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, but sales fell by 3.2% year on year to $24.48 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $89.7 billion at the midpoint came in 2% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.38 per share was 8.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Amazon to Cut 16,000 Jobs in Its Largest-Ever Corporate Layoffs
summary: Amazon.com  said Wednesday it will cut 16,000 jobs as the online retailer completes its largest-ever corporate layoffs.  The latest cuts will bring Amazon’s total layoffs to roughly 30,000 after it said last October it would eliminate around 14,000 roles.  Put together, the announcements suggest Amazon is slashing nearly 10% of its corporate workforce.

content.title: Amazon to Cut 16,000 Jobs in Its Largest-Ever Corporate Layoffs
content.summary: Amazon.com  said Wednesday it will cut 16,000 jobs as the online retailer completes its largest-ever corporate layoffs.  The latest cuts will bring Amazon’s total layoffs to roughly 30,000 after it said last October it would eliminate around 14,000 roles.  Put together, the announcements suggest Amazon is slashing nearly 10% of its corporate workforce.

headline: Amazon cuts 16,000 jobs globally to undo pandemic-era hiring amid AI push
summary: Amazon said on Wednesday it was cutting 16,000 jobs worldwide in the second major round of layoffs at the company in three months, ​as it restructures after pandemic-era over-hiring and expands the adoption of artificial intelligence tools.  Reuters ‌first reported last week that Amazon was planning a second round of job cuts as part of a broader ‌goal of trimming about 30,000 corporate roles, with the layoffs expected to affect workers in Amazon Web Services, retail, Prime Video and human resources departments.  Amazon slashed 14,000 white-collar jobs in late October, with CEO Andy Jassy stressing the need for the company to eliminate excessive bureaucracy by trimming ⁠operational levels and reducing the number ‌of managers.

content.title: Amazon cuts 16,000 jobs globally to undo pandemic-era hiring amid AI push
content.summary: Amazon said on Wednesday it was cutting 16,000 jobs worldwide in the second major round of layoffs at the company in three months, ​as it restructures after pandemic-era over-hiring and expands the adoption of artificial intelligence tools.  Reuters ‌first reported last week that Amazon was planning a second round of job cuts as part of a broader ‌goal of trimming about 30,000 corporate roles, with the layoffs expected to affect workers in Amazon Web Services, retail, Prime Video and human resources departments.  Amazon slashed 14,000 white-collar jobs in late October, with CEO Andy Jassy stressing the need for the company to eliminate excessive bureaucracy by trimming ⁠operational levels and reducing the number ‌of managers.

thumbnail.caption: Amazon plans a second round of job cuts
